title: Why Should We Lose LP, or Get Demoted, If A Player Intentional Feeds?
body:
I just got a teammate who literally just walked into enemy towers from start of the game to finish, and I'm not even sure why???
He claimed to be a Diamond smurf but someone disputed it and that was "disrespectful", APPARENTLY?

I muted all to retain my sanity but got demoted. I don't see why anyone deserves to be punished for someone else's behaviour.

replies.body: Because it is just as likely the opponents have an intentional feeder... (technically more likely the opponents int) and I dont see you saying you should not get LP if the opponents intentional feed. Also if your team was losing you could abuse a guy till he afk/int to save your lp
That is psycological, it is 5 times more likely for you to see something as negative than positive

M8 no one is haxoring your account and giving you bad players.

I see so many bronze and silver players complain about inters but in my 150-200 games of experience in this elo I have only ever encountered 2-3 inters.

I go by what I have always gone by, **you will climb if you deserve to climb.** Simple as that.

I can only assume its to keep you in rank, you can report it but I don't believe reports do anything.  At the end of the day RIOT is a company which needs players to keep playing, good or bad.

The more time you play this game, the more RIOT will make money off you in the long run.  I suggest to create games with friends or go to a net cafe where more players play together. 

That way you dont have to worry about playing randoms.
